WRITING.TEXT: I am sorry for take three days to reply, but I had troubles with my laptop. Thank you for your kind words *smile* and OMG!!! 6 cool cats, I am jealous you know, I only have my Snufkin and he can be VERY picky about many things but like you I like him so much. Love your cats names so much; Nova (star!), Burrito and Taco (Mexican food), Bubbles (childhood) and Zelda (video game), thank you for sharing with us your family cat (ahh Bubbless face!!!)
Ah then it's all based on the situation, right? Thank you for explaining the differences to me.
I love him, he is a very handsome cat!! And yes, like his name very much (Burrito 3). Please give him a big hug for me.

WRITING.TEXT: or something like that, humm like David Bowman in 2001: A Space Odyssey or Raistlin in Dragonlance. Due to magic, defeat the former god or goddess, technology. Romance is ok, but I don't want to read in excess, love triangles or sex scenes. Thank you.

I tried to walk but I have been inconsistent. I hope to improve.
Lo Cortez no quita lo Cabral vol 1 y Romanticos por siempre (solistas).

Congratulations, oh I saw you read Kokoro by Natsume Soseki, do you like it? :D
Im dealing with depression too, reading was my passion and could finish 12 books in a few weeks but now... last year I achieved 14 books in 12 months and this year I have only been able to read 1 book (snif), want to be a bookworm again.
These are some of the books I read last year and I would like to recommend; The Day of the Triffids by John Wyndham, 2001: A Space Odyssey by Arthur C. Clarke and The plague by Albert Camus, if you give them a chance I hope you like them, happy reading!

Old sister: married after finishing university, 4 children, 1 grandchild, social. Life is good! Me? FA, depressed, negative self-talk, suicidal thoughts, asocial, with problems to finish my PhD, my family doesn't suspect anything... yay???
I wish him a quick recovery and my Snufkin is sending healing purrs.

WRITING.TITLE: How do I figure out what genre The Friday Night Knitting Club by Kate Jacobs is?
WRITING.TEXT: I was organizing my wish list (62 word pages, oh my!) but I have doubts as The Friday Night Knitting Club by Kate Jacobs in which genre or genres should I put it? I saw The Friday nigt knitting club was classified by GR as chick-lit, but I have a problem with this because for me, chick-lit, hen/matron-lit and YA are only an age labels, a marketing strategy not a true genre, the first thing I thought was a slice of life, although in manga (Japanese comics) slice of life is considered a genre, in literature is a narrative technique, so Im unsure of which is the right one. Do you have any advice? Thank you. English isn't my first language, so please excuse any mistakes.

Thank you!

WRITING.TITLE: Recomindenme lugares/comida en Vallarta
WRITING.TEXT: Pues vern, en un par de semanas mi familia visita Puerto Vallarta, en la Zona Hotelera, la verdad..... no quiero ir, preferira estar en casa y todo eso. Lo que he visto va google no me entusiasma nada pero si consiguen arrastrarme con ellos, alguno de ustedes me recomienda algn lugar (excepto antros y cosas as) o comida? Gracias :D
De los puestos visitados en mi (dizque) ciudad no he visto ninguna desquitndose con la carne a machetazos, en uno picando cebolla, en varios son las meseras y/o quienes cobran.
